nodes.bodyText:
not really related to this PR, but the date format is rather uncommon for Germany and would also be used differently in the US.
Can we consistently use dd.MM.yy HH:mm in all places instead of dd/MM/yy HH:mm?
This means, can you please run a search and replace
dd/MM/yy HH:mm --> dd.MM.yy HH:mm
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,50 @@ +
+
+
+

+ +

+
+
{{ 'artemisApp.courseOverview.exerciseDetails.dueDate' | translate }}
+ {{ (exercise.dueDate | date: 'dd/MM/yy HH:mm') || 'N/A' }} + {{ exercise.dueDate | amTimeAgo }} +
+
+
{{ 'artemisApp.courseOverview.exerciseDetails.categories' | translate }}
+
+ {{ category.category }} +
+
+
+
+ + + + + + + +
+
{{ 'artemisApp.courseOverview.exerciseDetails.maxPoints' | translate }}
+ 		+ {{ exercise.maxScore }} pts. + +
+
{{ 'artemisApp.exercise.assessmentDueDate' | translate }}:
+ 		+ {{ (exercise.assessmentDueDate | date: 'dd/MM/yy HH:mm') || 'N/A' }}

nodes.bodyText: I agree that dd/MM/yy is pretty confusing. I replaced it.
